meanings.definition: A trap for large game consisting of a heavy weight that falls and crushes the prey.
meanings.sent1: Hunters in the past used deadfalls to catch animals for food.
meanings.sent2: The ancient tribes set up deadfalls to catch deer in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The deadfalls were so effective that the hunters always had fresh meat for dinner.
meanings.sent4: The deadfalls were like silent giants waiting to strike at any unsuspecting prey.
meanings.sent5: The image of the deadfalls crashing down on the prey stayed in the hunter's mind.
